question: F1: Will Max Verstappen finish ahead of Lewis Hamilton in the Qatar Grand Prix?
description:
This is a market on whether Max Verstappen will finish ahead of Lewis Hamilton in the Qatar Grand Prix, scheduled to take place at the Losail International Circuit on Sunday, November 21.

The market will resolve to “Yes” If Max Verstappen finishes ahead of Lewis Hamilton, and “No” otherwise. 

Note:
- If Max Verstappen finishes the race but Lewis Hamilton does not, the market will resolve to “Yes.” 
- If Lewis Hamilton finishes the race but Max Verstappen does not, this market will resolve to “No.” 
- If for any reason the Qatar Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date on or before November 21, 2021, the same market conditions will apply.
- If neither Lewis Hamilton nor Max Verstappen finish the race, or Qatar Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date after November 28, 2021, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: F1: Will there be a McLaren or a Ferrari car in the top 3 of the Qatar Grand Prix?
description:
This is a market on whether either a McLaren or a Ferrari car finishes in the top 3 in the Qatar Grand Prix, scheduled to take place at the Losail International Circuit on Sunday, November 21.

The market will resolve to “Yes” if at least one Ferrari or McLaren car finishes in the top 3 in Qatar Grand Prix, and “No” otherwise. 

If Qatar Grand Prix is rescheduled to a date after November 28, 2021, this market will resolve 50-50.

question: NBA: Will the Warriors beat the Pistons by more than 7.5 points in their November 19th matchup?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game, scheduled for November 19th:

If the Golden State Warriors win by over 7.5 points, the market will resolve to “Yes”.

If the Detroit Pistons lose by less than 7.5 points or win, the market will resolve “No.” 

If the game is not completed by November 26, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: NBA: Will the sum of points in Pelicans v Clippers be an even or odd number?
description:
In the upcoming NBA game between Los Angeles Clippers and New Orleans Pelicans, scheduled for November 19th:

If the total sum of points scored is an even number (ie. score is 120-118, 97-133, 115-115...), this market will resolve to “Even”.

If the total sum of points scored is an odd number (ie. score is 120-119, 97-132, 114-115...), this market will resolve to “Odd”.

If the game is not completed by November 26, 2021, the market will resolve 50-50.

question: Will Joe Biden's disapproval rating be 52.0% or higher at the end of November?
description:
This is a market on whether Joe Biden's disapproval rating will be 52.0% or higher for the day of November 30, 2021. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's approval rating poll aggregator, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/biden-approval-rating/, specifically the disapproval rating indicated by the orange trend line for the date of November 30, 2021. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates the (dis)approval rating will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. 

The resolution date for this market will be on December 1, 2021 at 12:00 PM ET according to data published for the day of November 30. If for any reason the resolution data is unavailable, the resolution source will be checked every 24 hours until the actual data is available. If the actual data is not available on the resolution source by December 7, 2021, 12:00 PM ET, this market will resolve to 50/50. 

If Joe Biden is not President on the resolution date, this market will resolve according to the most recent available approval rating.
